title: Unsigned numbers not showing up in diesel print-schema for MySQL
body:
<!--
If you want to report a bug, we added some points below you can fill out. If you want to request a feature, feel free to remove all the irrelevant text. In addition to this [issue tracker](https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/issues), you can also talk to Diesel maintainers and users on [Gitter](https://gitter.im/diesel-rs/diesel).
-->

## Setup

up.sql:
```sql
CREATE TABLE users (
    id INTEGER UNSIGNED PRIMARY KEY,
    pass_hash BINARY(60) NOT NULL,
    username VARCHAR(24) NOT NULL
)
```

### Versions

- **Rust:** 1.27.0-nightly bd40cbbe1 2018-04-14
- **Diesel:** 1.2.0
- **Database:** MySQL 5.7.21.0
- **Operating System** Windows 10 1709 build 16299.371

### Feature Flags

- **diesel:** `--no-default-features --features mysql`

## Problem Description

`diesel print-schema` does not correctly respect unsigned integers.

### What are you trying to accomplish?

Use an unsigned integer in a database.

### What is the expected output?

```rust
table! {
    users (id) {
        id -> Unsigned<Integer>,
        pass_hash -> Binary,
        username -> Varchar,
    }
}
```

### What is the actual output?

```rust
table! {
    users (id) {
        id -> Integer,
        pass_hash -> Binary,
        username -> Varchar,
    }
}
```

### Are you seeing any additional errors?

No.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Use `diesel migrate` to introduce the above table schema.
2. Run `diesel print-schema` and notice the lack of unsignedness.

## Checklist

- [x] I have already looked over the [issue tracker](https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/issues) for similar issues.
